1 /**
  2  * @fileOverview Requirejs module containing antie.Class top-level base class.
  3  *
  4  * Inspired by base2 and Prototype
  5  * @see http://ejohn.org/blog/simple-javascript-inheritance/
  6  *
  7  * @author John Resig <eresig@gmail.com>
  8  */
  9 
 10 require.def('antie/class', function() {
 11 
 12 	var initializing = false, fnTest = /xyz/.test(function(){xyz;}) ? /\b_super\b/ : /.*/;
 13 
 14 	/**
 15 	 * The base Class implementation (does nothing)
 16 	 * @name antie.Class
 17 	 * @class
 18 	 * @abstract
 19 	 */
 20 	var Class = function(){};
 21  
 22 	/**
 23 	 * Create a new Class that inherits from this class
 24 	 * @name extend
 25 	 * @memberOf antie.Class
 26 	 * @function
 27 	 * @static
 28 	 * @param {Object} prop Prototype to add to the new extended class.
 29 	 */
 30 	Class.extend = function(prop) {
 31 		var _super = this.prototype;
 32 	 
 33 		// Instantiate a base class (but only create the instance,
 34 		// don't run the init constructor)
 35 		initializing = true;
 36 		var prototype = new this();
 37 		initializing = false;
 38 	 
 39 		// Copy the properties over onto the new prototype
 40 		for (var name in prop) {
 41 			// Check if we're overwriting an existing function
 42 			prototype[name] = typeof prop[name] == "function" &&
 43 				typeof _super[name] == "function" && fnTest.test(prop[name]) ?
 44 				(function(name, fn){
 45 					return function() {
 46 						var tmp = this._super;
 47 					 
 48 						// Add a new ._super() method that is the same method
 49 						// but on the super-class
 50 						this._super = _super[name];
 51 					 
 52 						// The method only need to be bound temporarily, so we
 53 						// remove it when we're done executing
 54 						var ret = fn.apply(this, arguments);       
 55 						this._super = tmp;
 56 					 
 57 						return ret;
 58 					};
 59 				})(name, prop[name]) :
 60 				prop[name];
 61 		}
 62 	 
 63 		// The dummy class constructor
 64 		function Class() {
 65 			this.self = this;
 66 
 67 			// All construction is actually done in the init method
 68 			if ( !initializing && this.init )
 69 				this.init.apply(this, arguments);
 70 		}
 71 	 
 72 		// Populate our constructed prototype object
 73 		Class.prototype = prototype;
 74 	 
 75 		// Enforce the constructor to be what we expect
 76 		Class.constructor = Class;
 77 
 78 		// And make this class extendable
 79 		Class.extend = arguments.callee;
 80 	 
 81 		return Class;
 82 	};
 83 
 84 	return Class;
 85 });
 86
